00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMedian.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Oct 24 10:30:02 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing probe set quantification using median
00028  * as does MEDIAN.
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _QUANTMEDIAN_H_
00031 #define _QUANTMEDIAN_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/ChipLayout.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/ChipStream.h"

00041 #include <cmath>
00042 #include <vector>

00045 /// String describing iterplier summary method
00046 #define QUANTMEDIANSTR "median"
00047 
00048 #define QUANTMEDIAN_VERSION "1.0"
00049 
00050 /**
00051  *  Class for doing probe set quantification using median
00052  * as does MEDIAN.
00053  */
00054 class QuantMedian : public QuantExprMethod {
00055 
00056 public:
00057 
00058   /** 
00059    * What version of the algorithm are we implementing?
00060    * @return version string.
00061    */
00062   std::string getVersion();
00063 
00064   /**
00065    * Basic constructor.
00066    */
00067   QuantMedian(bool doMean=false, bool attenuate=true, float l=0.005, float h=-1);
00068 
00069   /** 
00070    * @brief Does this quantification method estimate feature effects?
00071    * @return true or false if getFeatureEffects() supplies estimates.
00072    */
00073   bool haveFeatureEffects();
00074 
00075   /** 
00076    * @brief Does this quantification method supply residuals?
00077    * @return Return true if getResidual() works, false otherwise.
00078    */
00079   bool haveResiduals();
00080 
00081   /** 
00082    * @brief Get the feature effect of a particular probe.
00083    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00084    * @return feature (probe) effects.
00085    */
00086   double getFeatureEffect(unsigned int probeIx);
00087   
00088   /** 
00089    * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00090    * primary interest.
00091    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00092    * @return estimated intensity.
00093    */
00094   double getTargetEffect(unsigned int chipIx);
00095 
00096   /** 
00097    * @brief Get the residual (the intensity not explained by
00098    * model). Supplied as log_2() transformed.
00099    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00100    * @param chipIx - Chip index in experiment.
00101    * @return intensity not explained by model.
00102    */
00103   double getResidual(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx);
00104 
00105   /** 
00106    * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00107    * primary interest. Alias for getTargetEffect()
00108    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00109    * @return estimated intensity.
00110    */
00111   double getSignalEstimate(unsigned int chipIx);
00112 
00113   /** 
00114    * @brief Clear out all the data.
00115    */
00116   void clear();
00117 
00118   /** 
00119    * @brief Set the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00120    * 
00121    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00122    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00123    * @param data - Data to be set.
00124    */
00125   void setPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data);
00126 
00127 /** 
00128    * @brief Get the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00129    * 
00130    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00131    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00132    */
00133   double getPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx);
00134 
00135   /** 
00136    * @brief Set the MM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00137    * 
00138    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00139    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00140    * @param data - Data to be set.
00141    */
00142   void setMMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data);
00143 
00144   /** 
00145    * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00146    * @param numProbes - Probe count.
00147    * @param numChips - Microarray count.
00148    */
00149   void setBounds(unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips);
00150 
00151   /** 
00152    * What scale are the target effects on? Are they linear (like
00153    * plier) or log2 (like median)
00154    * @return - What scale are the results provided in?
00155    */
00156   virtual Scale getScale();
00157 
00158   /** 
00159    * @brief Compute the median. If PM-MM is zero
00160    * threshold at a small positive number to avoid taking logs of
00161    * numbers that aren't positive.
00162    */
00163   void computeEstimate();
00164 
00165   /** 
00166    * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00167    * set, chip layout and data.
00168    * 
00169    * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00170    * @param layout - Chip layout annotation.
00171    * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00172    * @param iTrans - Transfomediantions to be applied to data before use.
00173    * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00174    * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00175    */
00176   bool setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart,
00177              std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00178 
00179   /** 
00180    * @brief Return number of features (probes).
00181    * @return feature count.
00182    */
00183   unsigned int getNumFeatures();
00184 
00185   /** 
00186    * @brief Return number of targets (experiments or chips).
00187    * @return target count
00188    */
00189   unsigned int getNumTargets();
00190 
00191   /** 
00192    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00193    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00194    */
00195   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions();
00196 
00197   /** 
00198    * Fill in the infomediantion for Self documentation.
00199    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00200    */
00201   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc);
00202 
00203   /** 
00204    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00205    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00206    * @return SelfDoc
00207    */
00208   static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00209 
00210   /** 
00211    * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00212    * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00213    * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00214    * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00215    * 
00216    * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00217    * 
00218    * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00219    */
00220   static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00221 
00222   /**
00223    * Custom configuration for this QuantMethod
00224    */
00225   virtual void setParameters(PsBoard &board) {
00226     // no-op here to override the error from parent class
00227   }
00228 
00229 private:
00230   /// Number of chips in experiment
00231   unsigned int m_ChipCount;
00232   /// Number of probes (features) in probe sets
00233   unsigned int m_ProbeCount;
00234   /// Data matrix for PM probes.
00235   std::vector<std::vector<float> > m_PM;
00236   /// Data matrix for MM estimates.
00237   std::vector<std::vector<float> > m_MM;
00238   /// Chip effects (medians)
00239   std::vector<float> m_Summaries;
00240   /// Should we use the mean rather than the median
00241   bool m_DoMean;
00242   /// Should we use an attenuated mismatch, or simply cap the lower bounds when using non-PM-only adjuster
00243   bool m_Attenuate;
00244   /// Tunable parameter for handling background value in non-PM-only adjusters
00245   float m_L;
00246   /// Override use of computed H from data with fixed constant in background attenuation
00247   float m_H;
00248 };
00249 
00250 #endif /* _QUANTMEDIAN_H_ */
